title: His Girl Friday Font?
content:
Does anyone know what font(s) are used in the opening credits of "His Girl Friday"?

For reference:  
 [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eezwbEZ2lB0&feature=PlayList&p=FF6484581E...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131200947/http:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=eezwbEZ2lB0&feature=PlayList&p=FF6484581E488249&playnext=1&playnext_from=PL&index=31 "http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eezwbEZ2lB0&feature=PlayList&p=FF6484581E488249&playnext=1&playnext\_from=PL&index=31")
author: TCTempo

comments.content:
Here are a few screen grabs:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131200947im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1_5147.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131200947im_/http:/typophile.com/files/2_4148.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131200947im_/http:/typophile.com/files/3_6739.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131200947im_/http:/typophile.com/files/4_4978.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131200947im_/http:/typophile.com/files/6_6316.png)
  
Short answer: no fonts involved. This was hand-lettered.  
F

You can get pretty close to ‘GRANT’ with Charles Borges’ new [LHF Gloria](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131200947/http:/letterheadfonts.com/fonts/gloria.php).  
Check out [Mostra Three](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131200947/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/mark_simonson/mostra_three_bold/&sample_text=RUSSELL&sample_size=74) by [Mark Simonson](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131200947/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Mark%20Simonson) for an ‘S’ as in ‘RUSSELL’.

The serif caps in the last picture remind me of [Nicholas Cochin](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131200947/http:/www.p22.com/lanston/cochin.html). Also reminiscent: [MVB Sirenne](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131200947/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/mvb_fonts/sirenne_eighteen_roman/&sample_text=WELL%2C%20ONCE%20UPON%20A%20TIME&sample_size=24) or [Incognito](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131200947/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fountain/incognito_pro_regular/&sample_text=WELL%2C%20ONCE%20UPON%20A%20TIME&sample_size=24).

The script is similar to Harold Lohner's [Easter Parade](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131200947/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=HAFO-EAPA), which is from the 40's.

[edit: should say "one of the scripts" is similar (the one with the odd e's)  
]  
- Mike Yanega
